intro: Test your knowledge of this week's Herald news!

questions.question: What percent of the University’s endowment comprises directly owned, publicly traded securities?
questions.explanation: 4% of the University's endowment are directly owned, publicly traded securities. The seven securities included in this category are asset managers, exchange-traded funds and psychedelic-assisted therapy companies. The remainder of the non-cash portion of the endowment is invested in external management services “across multiple asset classes.” Amid calls for divestment from Israel, University Investment Office officials stressed at a UCS town hall Thursday that Brown has no direct investments in defense manufacturers and that the endowment’s only potential ties to the industry are through these broader funds and indices.

questions.question: Which team saw a win following a 17-point deficit this weekend?
questions.explanation: Women’s basketball defeated Monmouth in a 59-58 victory on Sunday, with Kyla Jones ‘24 named Ivy League Player of the Week after tying career-high scoring record.

questions.question: Which former NAACP president was announced to speak at the 2024 Martin Luther King Jr. Lecture?
questions.explanation: Ifill — a civil rights lawyer one of Time Magazine’s 100 Most Influential People in 2021 — will speak to community members in February for the University’s annual MLK Jr. Lecture.

questions.question: Which artist released their album “Heaven knows” this November?
questions.explanation: On Nov. 10, PinkPanthress released her debut album — which included a feature from rapper Central Cee and a variety of emotional tracks.

questions.question: Which campus-adjacent site is currently under construction?
questions.explanation: The park — located on the corner of Brook St. and Arnold St. — is set to complete its construction in spring to include new playgrounds, seating areas and fencing.

questions.question: Which Canadian actor-comedian’s newest project features himself alongside Emma Stone?
questions.explanation: Fielder’s newest series, “The Cure,” is a psychological thriller, which places its emphasis less on comedy and more on an unsettling narrative.

questions.question: What percentage of Brown students pursue some form of graduate school or professional study within 10 years post-grad?
questions.explanation: 80% of of Brown students pursue some form of graduate school or professional study within 10 years post-grad. Across campus, undergraduates shared differing views on their plans for attending graduate school following their time at Brown.

questions.question: This fiscal year, the University saw the largest net assets for the period between 2019 and 2023 excluding which year?
questions.explanation: The University saw a 2.2% increase in its net assets, which are valued at $7.7 billion, during the 2023 fiscal year, according to the University’s annual financial report

questions.question: What is the name of the group that organized the second annual bouldering competition the Rhode Island Ripper?
questions.explanation: On Nov. 21, the Ladies Climbing Coalition hosted Rhode Island Ripper at Lincoln Woods, inviting rock climbing enthusiasts from across the Providence area.

questions.question: The University’s concurrent degree program allows students to do which of the following?
choices: Obtain a degree from both Brown and RISD
Obtain a Bachelor of Arts and Bachelor of Science degree in five years
Combine their last year(s) of undergraduate study with graduate study
questions.explanation: Although undergraduates are not technically eligible to take graduate courses, many opt to take these higher-level classes for various reasons.
